title: Will Trump’s Tariff Deal Tilt the Playing Field Back Toward China?
summary: The president’s trade truce with China has lowered U.S. tariffs to a level that could pause a longer-term effort to reduce America’s dependence on Beijing.

title: Trump Administration Highlights: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Guard Deployment in Portland
N.Y.C. Early Voting Ends With 735,000 Ballots Cast, as Younger Voters Surge
summary: This year’s mayoral race saw the highest early in-person turnout ever for a nonpresidential election in New York.

title: Indiana Republican Tries Different Approach in Debate on Voting Maps: Listening
summary: As redistricting efforts spread across the country, an Indiana state senator said he isn’t sure how he will vote on a plan that President Trump supports.

title: A Thrilling Finish to N.Y.C. Marathon as Kenyans Dominate Elite Races
summary: It was a record-setting day as more than 50,000 athletes packed the streets for the 2025 New York City Marathon. Benson Kipruto and Hellen Obiri triumphed.

title: The NYC Marathon in Photos and Videos
summary: Some 55,000 people came out to race through the five boroughs on a sunny Sunday.

title: Kipruto Wins NYC Marathon Men’s Race in One of the Closest Ever Finishes
summary: Some past New York marathons have been extremely tight. Benson Kipruto’s split-second victory was a photo finish.

title: 2025 New York City Marathon: Best Fashion Looks
summary: Held on a Halloween weekend, this year’s race had a mother-and-daughter duo dressed as cows, a human-size banana and Ken (without Barbie).

title: Arrests in Louvre Heist Show Power of DNA Databases in Solving Crimes
summary: France’s trove of DNA profiles has helped solve high-profile crimes and was used to find some of the Louvre suspects, and it is growing. The police can also access other countries’ databases.

title: Maria Riva, Dietrich Daughter Who Demystified the Legend, Dies at 100
summary: She was her mother’s handmaiden and aide-de-camp. In 1993, her blockbuster biography told of the awful price she paid.

title: Bill Gates Has a Point
summary: Climate change is not a giant meteor crashing into Earth. We will not all suffer equally.

title: How Maduro Future-Proofed His Dictatorship in Venezuela
summary: Maduro has built a system in which the only people who can truly tear down the dictatorship are the ones with the most to lose from its demise.

title: At Least 10 Dead and Hundreds Injured After Strong Quake Hits Afghanistan
summary: The 6.3-magnitude quake struck near Mazar-i-Sharif, a northern city known for its magnificent Blue Mosque. The extent of the damage was not immediately clear.

title: Explosion at Harvard Building Affected Small Section of Hallway, Officials Say
summary: There was no structural damage to the building, they said, as investigators pursued two suspects.

title: Martha Layne Collins, 88, Dies; Kentucky’s First Female Governor
summary: She rose from a junior high school teacher to the state’s top official, and helped persuade Toyota to build its first American factory in Georgetown, Ky.
